page.title: 06ST.MICHAEL'S MOUNT CASTLE-1
page.content: The main doorway to the castle was once the entrance to the monastery. The{Chevy Chase Room}was the refectory of the monastery and may be 12th century. The name comes from a plaster frieze of hunting scenes which goes right around the room. It has a long oak table and the chairs are models of those used by the monks. The{Blue Drawing Rooms}are elegantly furnished with blue upholstery and curtains and have family portraits on the pale blue walls. The{Church}was rebuilt in the 14th century, following an earthquake, but much of the ornamentation is modern. Services are held each Sunday and the church holds the Investiture of the Order of St. John. There are many other buildings and rooms including the{armoury.}
